title: Chief of Staff to CEO
content:
Join one of the world's fastest growing fintech startups! We're looking for smart, motivated team members who want to change the way people pay their bills, helping them to improve their financial success.THE ROLE
The Chief of Staff will hold a critical, impactful position helping doxo drive productivity, strategic initiatives, and key projects. You will work closely with the CEO and in many situations be required to act on the CEO’s behalf, working closely with doxo’s entire leadership team to achieve greater business velocity, faster decision making, and aligned focus to drive business results. Doxo culture is data-driven and analytic.  Candidates should demonstrate strong objective problem solving skills, ability to use data and quantitative analysis to evaluate and drive decisions, and the ability to work with teams to align on objectives and resolve differences of approach to achieve outcomes.This is an ideal position for a candidate to gain C-suite experience as part of a pathway to future positions of executive leadership.
Responsibilities:

Act as trusted confidant to the CEO
Establish a close working relationship, providing advice and feedback, acting as a sounding board, and offering a fresh perspective
Lead and support special projects and initiatives on behalf of the CEO, coordinating cross-functional teams, establishing timelines, and monitoring progress to ensure successful and timely completion
Use analytic tools to collect and analyze data, contribute to development of KPIs and decision making frameworks, and provide data-driven insights to support decision making processes
Anticipate opportunities and challenges relevant to projects or initiatives and take appropriate mitigating steps
Ensure that the CEOs time, energy, and impact are optimized
Work with teams to execute follow up actions from key decisions and ensure execs and teams are prepared prior to progress updates
Support and facilitate the leadership team in communicating the decision-making, program management, and initiative implementations throughout doxo
Support the CEO in communicating overall business strategy and goals to each function, while helping set these goals at the beginning of every quarter

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree required, advanced graduate degree preferred.  Degrees and/or experience demonstrating quantitative analytic capabilities are strongly preferred.
At least 5 years of experience working and/or engaging actively with  executive level leadership required
Demonstrated initiative taking in work and educational experience
High degree of professionalism and executive level business standards.  
Very strong writing skills, especially in simplifying complex issues, and using data to support and explain key points, decisions, and assessing outcomes.
Demonstrated ability to write and speak with high standards of professionalism - able to develop materials for executive and board use
Strong influence skills with a track record of getting buy in for your ideas
Strong business acumen with an understanding of what drives value for a business
Strong executive presence and EQ
Willingness to broach difficult topics, drive forward with challenging or unpopular decisions
Versatility with the ability to collaborate and partner with a diverse range of teams and individuals
Data driven with experience driving decisions through quantitative analysis
Velocity and agility that drives strategic and hands-on work
Preferred: Experience in the startup space
Preferred: Consulting experience with a focus on technical products
Preferred: Product and/or Program Management experience
Preferred: Experience working directly with a SaaS product

WHO WE ARE
Each year U.S. households spend over $3.8 trillion - about one third of all consumer spending - on recurring bill payments. While staying on top of these bills is the single largest determinant for consumer financial health, organizing and paying them can be a time-consuming and frustrating chore. Since its inception, doxo has been on a mission to simplify and reduce the anxiety of staying on top of bills, empowering consumers to improve their financial health. Our company was founded on the simple idea that there should be an easy and more secure way for consumers to pay all of their bills through a single account, with any payment method, on any device. 
As consumers shift more bill payments online and to mobile, doxo continues to experience rapid growth. To date, over eight million doxo users across 97% of U.S. zip codes have paid bills through the payment network, across more than 45 different service categories. With more than 120,000 payable billers, doxo’s proprietary, crowd sourced provider directory is the largest in the nation. 
doxo is consistently recognized as both an innovative company and a great place to work by the likes of Inc. Magazine, Deloitte, Comparably, and BuiltIn. Come join us as we grow the team to further accelerate growth, forever changing the bill pay landscape to focus on the customer.
WHY WE ARE DIFFERENT 
doxo is unique in that we have already found product/market fit and that our service is filling an important market need every day. But we are still small enough that every employee, no matter their position, can make a meaningful impact. Because transparency is a priority at all levels across the organization, we are all aware of how our work contributes to the success of our business as a whole. We are agile and work hard to solve difficult problems quickly. We work as a team to get things done and mentor individuals to get to the next level in their career.
OUR COMPANY PERKS AND BENEFITS:

100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for full-time employees
Generous equity grants
401k match to help you save for your future
15 days PTO to start, plus paid holidays
Charitable donation match
Pet insurance
Plus plenty of corporate discounts

Many Perks and Benefits only apply to Full Time Equivalent roles.
The annual base salary for this role is $140,000 - $190,000.  Starting pay will be based on several factors and commensurate with qualifications and experience.  Stock Options are also part of the compensation package for full time roles.doxo is an equal-opportunity employer and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds.
